title: Digestion. Pt. 2: chemical changes
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Anatomy
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Body, Human
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Digestion
description: An account of the chief changes involved in the chemical breakdown of the main types of foodstuffs during digestion. Shows the secretion of saliva and its action on cooked starch; the gastric glands; secretion of intestinal bile and pancreatic juice and their effect on proteins, carbohydrates and fats; the absorption of nutriment through the villi and lacteals into the blood and its subsequent circulation through the body.
